Bio

I'm currently a first-year Ph.D. student at the Urban Design & Planning Interdisciplinary Ph.D. Program at the University of Washington, advised by Prof. Jan Whittington and Prof. Qing Shen. I'm also a part of the Urban Infrastructure Lab at UW and the oversea city observer in Urban China Magazine. I always have had a passion for all space and phenomena in cities and now my research interests lie in infrastructure planning, urban carbon governance, and the combination of urban studies and data science. Check my CV here.

Courseworks

During my Ph.D. stage, I plan to complete several course clusters, including public policy and institutions, climate change, infrastructure finance, data science and statistics, for getting a solid knowledge background at the beginning of two years. The arrangement is a continuation of my previous master's degree at UW which focused on Urban Informatics and Technologies. And please check my full coursework list here to see what I've done and my future plans. Also, you can refer to the programs and courses recommended by the Urban Infrastructure Lab.

News

  • [05/18/23] Attended Spatial Social Network Workshop at Georgia Tech.
  • [11/03/22] Attended ACSP 2022 in Toronto and Presented the Master Thesis on Climate Investment and Green Gentrification in San Francisco-Oakland-Berkeley Bay Area.
  • [09/28/22] Started the PhD in Urban Design and Planning at the University of Washington.
  • [06/18/22] Graduated from Master of Urban Planning Program at the University of Washington.
  • [10/15/21] Attended ACSP 2021 with Prof. Christine Bae on Effects of Zoning and Land Use Policies on Land Value and Densification in the City of Seattle.
